abstract: Supreme Court refuses to allow Kim Davis, clerk in Rowan County, Ky, who objects to same-sex marriage on religious grounds, to continue to deny marriage licenses to all couples.
lead_paragraph: The new case from Kentucky, Davis v. Miller, was the court’s first opportunity to consider whether government officials may refuse to recognize same-sex marriages on religious grounds.

headline.main: Supreme Court Says Kentucky Clerk Must Let Gay Couples Marry
headline.print_headline: Justices Deny Bid to Resist Gay Marriage in Kentucky

snippet: The new case from Kentucky, Davis v. Miller, was the court’s first opportunity to consider whether government officials may refuse to recognize same-sex marriages on religious grounds.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
